channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024101815
item.description:
Report X-2024101815

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WAS WET DUE TO CONDENSATION FROM DRY ICE. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE CHUNKS COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024101750
item.description:
Report X-2024101750

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTICED WET HAZMAT PACKAGE ON BELT. SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP AND RMP SENDED RESPONDER TO METRO BAY 153. RESPONDER ARRIVES WITH DECISION TREE, PPE ON, AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED LEAKING PACKAGE, INCLUDING REMAINING LIQUID SPILLED OUT.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LOADER NOTICED LEAKING PACKAGE ON CONVEYOR BELT. LOADER LEAVES AREA AND NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH DECISION TREE, PPE ON, AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINDED LEAKING PACKAGE, INCLUDING REMAINING LIQUID FROM SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2024100713
item.description:
Report E-2024100713

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was punctured and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ LLC to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100716
item.description:
Report E-2024100716

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 18, 2024, eleven (11) 5-gallon pails of paint were dented by the shipper and released approximately seven (7) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+, LLC (ES+) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100709
item.description:
Report E-2024100709

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 16, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, plywood, and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged drum and overpacked it in one (1) 85-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was contained in the same overpack drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100712
item.description:
Report E-2024100712

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO XLA reported a 1-liter release of Euro Glass Clear Medium Activator from One 2.5-liter poly jug to the packaging and the other jug in the case. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and provided it by email. The terminal will place the damaged case with both jugs into (1) 5-gallon metal drum.
